title: Isaiah Prophesies that the Syria-Israel Coalition Will Fail
html:
2 Nephi 17:3–4. "The upper pool" Isaiah takes his son with him and meets King Ahaz by the conduit of the upper pool (King Ahaz was probably checking the water supply in preparation for an attack).

2 Nephi 17:4. "Two . . . smoking firebrands" The two kings who want to attack Judah are compared to smoldering remains of firewood, or torches that have no fire or danger left in them.

2 Nephi 17:5–6. "Set a king in the midst of it" Syria and Israel intended to conquer Ahaz and put their own king, "the Son of Tabeal," in his place.

2 Nephi 17:8. Three score and five = 65 Isaiah prophesies that Damascus will remain the "head," or capital city of Syria alone, and that in sixty-five years, Ephraim will be gone (this was fulfilled when the Assyrians captured the kingdom of Israel in A.D. 721.)
